textContent:
Chapter 1. 

The story about Ben and Leah shows how trust was created at the very start of the relationship through doing what he said, and providing what she needed, without expectation (i.e. the sweatshirt). That trust led her to say she hasn't trusted anyone that much in her life. When I read this I feel dismayed. I remember the beginning of our relationship was very much like Ben. I kept asking you questions so you couldn't say you didn't like me. But very early into our relationship I felt like our trust was broken. We broke up which meant when things didn't go the way I wanted we didn't get real with each other. We didn't say we are going to figure this out. We just stopped. And that broke trust. From the very beginning we didn't build a foundation of trust and commitment and because of this I wonder if it's ever really been there. We havent ever really figured out how to love each other for each other's differences. Instead, we've learned to accommodate each other, help each other, and sacrifice for each other. But not out of a deepening love and commitment. Out of a sense of comfort, familiarity and convenience. Our marriage wasn't an affirmation of our commitment together. It was a statement of obligation to serve each other. But do we actually love each other for each other? Do we actually get along? Do we actually share
